snippet: For more than a decade, employers haven’t rewarded the skills of college-educated workers.
abstract: Editorial cites research done by economists Paul Beaudry, David Green and Benjamin Sand on the reasons for wage stagnation; contends policies like a higher minimum wage, better trade pact and more support for union organizing are needed to lift wages.
lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, employers haven’t rewarded the skills of college-educated workers.

headline.main: Where Have All the Raises Gone?
headline.print_headline: Where Have All the Raises Gone?

keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
keywords.name: organizations
